semantic_title: Counseling Z Code Guidelines for Patient and Family Support Services
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 21. Factors influencing health status and contact with health services (Z00-Z99) > 10. Counseling

content.full_text: Counseling Z codes are used when a patient or family member receives assistance in the aftermath of an illness or injury, or when support is required in coping with family or social problems. The counseling Z codes/categories: Z30.0- Encounter for general counseling and advice on contraception Z31.5 Encounter for procreative genetic counseling Z31.6- Encounter for general counseling and advice on procreation Z32.2 Encounter for childbirth instruction Z32.3 Encounter for childcare instruction Z69 Encounter for mental health services for victim and perpetrator of abuse Z70 Counseling related to sexual attitude, behavior and orientation Z71 Persons encountering health services for other counseling and medical advice, not elsewhere classified Note: Code Z71.84, Encounter for health counseling related to travel, is to be used for health risk and safety counseling for future travel purposes. Code Z71.85, Encounter for immunization safety counseling, is to be used for counseling of the patient or caregiver regarding the safety of a vaccine. This code should not be used for the provision of general information regarding risks and potential side effects during routine encounters for the administration of vaccines. Code Z71.87, Encounter for pediatric-to-adult transition counseling, should be assigned when pediatric-to-adult transition counseling is the sole reason for the encounter or when this counseling is provided in addition to other services, such as treatment of a chronic condition. If both transition counseling and treatment of a medical condition are provided during the same encounter, the code(s) for the medical condition(s) treated and code Z71.87 should be assigned, with sequencing depending on the circumstances of the encounter. Z76.81 Expectant mother prebirth pediatrician visit (Evidence: pg no: 102, L67-L84)
content.summary: Guidelines for using counseling Z codes when patients or family members receive assistance after illness/injury or need support for family/social problems, with specific rules for various counseling types (Evidence: pg no: 102, L67-L84)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Z71.85 should not be used for the provision of general information regarding risks and potential side effects during routine encounters for the administration of vaccines (Evidence: pg no: 102, L78-L79)
detailed_rules.explanation: This code is specifically for dedicated counseling sessions about vaccine safety, not for routine information given during vaccination encounters (Evidence: pg no: 102, L78-L79)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Z71.87 should be assigned when pediatric-to-adult transition counseling is the sole reason for the encounter or when provided in addition to other services (Evidence: pg no: 102, L79-L81)
detailed_rules.explanation: This code can be used as primary or additional depending on whether transition counseling is the only service or provided alongside other care (Evidence: pg no: 102, L79-L81)
common_applications: Transition counseling during chronic disease management

detailed_rules.rule_text: When both transition counseling and treatment of a medical condition are provided, assign codes for medical condition(s) and Z71.87, with sequencing depending on encounter circumstances (Evidence: pg no: 102, L81-L83)
detailed_rules.explanation: Both the medical condition codes and transition counseling code should be assigned, with sequencing based on the primary focus of the encounter (Evidence: pg no: 102, L81-L83)
common_applications: Chronic disease visits with transition planning

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify if encounter involves counseling services
Step 2: Determine if counseling is for aftermath of illness/injury or family/social problems

Step 4: For specific codes (Z71.84, Z71.85, Z71.87), verify proper usage criteria
Step 5: If multiple services provided, determine appropriate sequencing
Step 6: Assign additional codes as needed for medical conditions treated
